text:
<@U0Z81GL6S> Am I correct that *v0.6* (_branch v0.6_) (_with HFC v0.6.2_) is an appropriate hyperledger version *to use where TLS is available*? 
There were several TLS related commits last days.
<@U2P2DHQSJ> yes, you can use Hyperledger fabric branch v0.6 and hfc v0.6.3 (latest). thanks

<@U0Z81GL6S> 
Hyperledger *v0.6*. A question about proto file *chaincode.proto*.
*ChaincodeInput* message definition: it *does not* have *function* field anymore. Consequently, generated classes (_Objective C_) do not have corresponding field.
So, where to put a function name to invoke a transaction? 


Looked through *tlsca_sample.js* sample client – it still uses the field:
“function invoke() {
    var args = getArgs(config.invokeRequest);
    // Construct the invoke request
    var invokeRequest = {
        // Name (hash) required for invoke
        chaincodeID: testChaincodeID,
        // Function to trigger
        fcn: config.invokeRequest.*functionName*,
        // Parameters for the invoke function
        args: args
    };

    // Trigger the invoke transaction
    var invokeTx = deployer.invoke(invokeRequest);”

Are proto files valid?
